channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: PURE GOLD: Trifecta of Community Notes Takes Down Iran's Supreme Leader
Trump campaign accelerates vetting of potential running mates
item.description: With the start of the Republican Party's presidential nominating convention less than six weeks away, Donald Trump's campaign is picking up the pace in vetting the potential running mates

item.title: Rep. Donalds: Dems Liars for Twisting My Words on Jim Crow
item.description: Rep. Byron Donalds, R-Fla., who is reportedly on former President Donald Trump's shortlist for a running mate, hit back at Democrats on Wednesday, calling them liars for taking his words out of context regarding comments he made about Black families in the Jim Crow era.

item.title: Money for Nothing and Chicks for Free: Hunter Biden's Delaware Trial - Day 3
Florida and Kansas are accusing 2 people of forging signatures for petition drives
item.description: Officials accused petition circulators of forging signatures of voters to allow the No Labels party to put candidates on the Kansas ballot and to put an abortion rights measure to a vote in Florida.

item.title: RFK Jr. to Newsmax: Media Needs to Call Out Fauci on Perjuries
item.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told Newsmax on Wednesday that "we need the press, particularly the mainstream media to start calling him [Dr. Anthony Fauci] out on these perjuries."

item.title: Palestinian Propaganda: Inside Portland's Kindergarten Intifada
School boards group backs out of teacher exchange program amid ex-North Dakota lawmaker's charges
item.description: Months after an indictment was unsealed against former ND Sen. Ray Holmberg, a ND school boards organization returned more than $140,000 to the state and ceased its role in a teacher exchange program.

item.title: Rep. Jordan to Newsmax: Hunter Gun Case Distracts From His Bigger Ones
item.description: The current spectacle of Hunter Biden's gun case is a red herring distracting from bigger concerns such as the first son's appointment on the board of Ukrainian gas giant Burisma, Chair of the House Judiciary Committee Jim Jordan, R-Ohio, told Newsmax on Wednesday.

item.title: Winning: Progressives Flip Out Over Arizona Ballot Referendum to Let Border Police Arrest Illegals
Rural South Dakota voters reject proposal to require hand-counting of ballots
item.description: Voters in South Dakota's rural Gregory, Haakon and Tripp counties have rejected proposals to require that ballots be hand-counted in future elections.

item.title: RFK Jr. Tries to Increase Support by Using Trump Verdict
item.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is attempting to use former President Donald Trump's guilty verdict in his New York trial to court voters who may be on the fence regarding the conviction.

item.title: Pride Woes: BMW Finds Out the Hard Way That Virtue Signaling for Virtue Signaling's Sake Is Rather Stupid
Inherently complicated: House Republicans consider another angle to take on Attorney General Garland
item.description: Republicans on the House Oversight and Judiciary Committees voted to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt of Congress for his refusal to release audio recordings of an interview with President Biden.

item.title: FBI Whistleblower Regains Security Clearance Following Jan 6. Claims
item.description: A former FBI staff operations specialist who had his security clearance suspended over "security concerns" about his "allegiance to the United States" has won a settlement with the bureau, his attorneys said on Tuesday.
